analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du zad ces smra zhes zer ba ni / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, when you ask, “Why is it said that this, namely ‘Bodhisattva,’ is merely a name?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is said that this, namely ‘Bodhisattva,’ is merely a name because it is a name that is adventitiously ascribed.

original: de'i phyir na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‘This is merely a name,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya'o //🔽chos thams cad kyi ming ni phyogs bcu po rnams gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya'o // chos thams cad kyi ming ni phyogs bcu po rnams gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: namely, “bodhisattva.”🔽The names of all phenomena do not come from the ten directions,

original: gang du yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro //
translated: do not go to the ten directions,

original: gang du yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gang du yang mi gnas so //
translated: and do not remain anywhere.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /🔽gang du yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong / gang du yang mi 'gro //
translated: In the same way, the name “bodhisattva” does not come from anywhere,🔽does not go anywhere,

original: gar yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gar yang mi gnas so //
translated: and does not remain anywhere.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is like this:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: “Form,” “feeling,” “perception,” “volitional factors,” and “consciousness” are merely names that are designated adventitiously.

original: 'di ltar ming ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med /
translated: In this way, a name does not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang mi 'gro /
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro /
translated: does not go anywhere,

original: gang na yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas so //
translated: and does not remain anywhere.

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin /
translated: What is called “merely a name” is not form,

original: tshor ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not feeling.

original: 'du shes ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes ma yin /
translated: It is not perception.

original: 'du byed rnams ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ma yin /
translated: It is not volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ma yin no //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ma yin no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is not consciousness.

original: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: If you ask why, it is because name is empty of the intrinsic nature of name.

original: stong pa gang yin pa de ni ming ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stong pa gang yin pa de ni ming ma yin te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: That which is empty is not name.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, this—namely, “bodhisattva”—is said to be a mere name.

original: skye mched ces bya ba dang / khams zhes bya ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched ces bya ba dang / khams zhes bya ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this—namely, “the sense fields,” “the components,” and “dependent origination”—is a name that is adventitiously ascribed.

original: 'di ltar ming ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: Name does not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro //
translated: does not go anywhere,

original: gang na yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas so //
translated: and does not remain anywhere.

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni skye mched ma yin /🔽khams ma yin /
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni skye mched ma yin / khams ma yin /
translated: That which is called “a mere name” is not the sense fields,🔽is not the components,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: and is not dependent origination.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: It is because a name is empty of the nature of a name.

original: stong pa nyid gang yin pa @295a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang yin pa @295a * //
translated: That which is emptiness

original: de ni ming ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ming ma yin te /
translated: is not a name.

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya'o //
translated: ‘Bodhisattva’ is a mere name.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang 'di ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang 'di ni ming tsam ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, moreover, this is a mere name,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‘perfection of generosity.’

original: ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming med do //
analyzed: ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming med do //
translated: The perfection of generosity is not in the name, and a name is not in the perfection of generosity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /
translated: It is because both that which is a name and that which is the perfection of generosity do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: ‘Bodhisattva’ is a mere name.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ming tsam ste /
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are merely names.

original: ming la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: ming la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: In a name there is no perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming med do//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming med do//
translated: And a perfection of wisdom is not a name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Because both the name and the perfection of wisdom are non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, this—namely, a bodhisattva—is merely a name.

original: 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid ni ming tsam ste /🔽ming la yang nang stong pa nyid med /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid ni ming tsam ste / ming la yang nang stong pa nyid med /
translated: Thus, inner emptiness is merely a name.🔽In a name there is no inner emptiness.

original: nang stong pa nyid la yang ming med do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la yang ming med do //
translated: And inner emptiness is not a name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, both the name and the emptiness of internal phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, this—namely, “a bodhisattva”—is merely a name.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ming tsam ste /🔽ming la yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid med /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ming tsam ste / ming la yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid med /
translated: Up to and including the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, are merely names.🔽A name does not exist in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la yang ming med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la yang ming med do //
translated: The emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature does not exist in a name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, both the name and the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature are non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, this—namely, “a bodhisattva”—is merely a name.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for these reasons this—namely, “a bodhisattva”—is merely a name.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya'o //
translated: ‘Bodhisattva’ is merely a designation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is like this:

original: @295b dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /🔽ming la yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams med /
analyzed: @295b dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste / ming la yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams med /
translated: ‘The applications of mindfulness’ is a designation that is suddenly given.🔽The applications of mindfulness are not in the name,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la yang ming med do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la yang ming med do //
translated: and the name is not in the applications of mindfulness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: it is because both the name and the applications of mindfulness do not exist and are not found.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo /
translated: Therefore, ‘bodhisattva’ is merely a designation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is like this:

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /🔽ming la yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa med /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste / ming la yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa med /
translated: The four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are merely names that have been designated adventitiously.🔽The noble eightfold path is not a name.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la yang ming med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la yang ming med do //
translated: A name is not the noble eightfold path.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because both the name and the noble eightfold path do not exist and are not found.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, this—namely, “bodhisattva”—is merely a name.

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /🔽ming la yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste / ming la yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med /
translated: the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are merely names that have been designated adventitiously.🔽A name is not the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la yang ming med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la yang ming med do //
translated: The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not a name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: it is because both the name and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, this—namely, “a bodhisattva”—is merely a name.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is thus:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: This so-called ‘knowledge of all aspects’ is a name that is suddenly given.

original: ming la yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med /
analyzed: ming la yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med /
translated: A name does not have a knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang ming med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang ming med do //
translated: and a knowledge of all aspects does not have a name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang @296a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang @296a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yin pa de gnyis ka yang med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Because both that which is a name and that which is a knowledge of all aspects are non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du dper na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du dper na /
translated: Therefore, this—namely, ‘bodhisattva’—is just a name.

original: bdag bdag ces brjod kyang bdag shin tu mngon par ma grub po zhes smra zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: bdag bdag ces brjod kyang bdag shin tu mngon par ma grub po zhes smra zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, you say, ‘For example, although one says “self, self,” a self is utterly unestablished.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, since a self is utterly non-existent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it be established?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, if sentient beings, life-force, nourishment, man, person, human, human being, agent, feeler, knower,

original: lta ba po shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: lta ba po shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: and seer are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they come into being?

original: gzugs shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gzugs shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If form is utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it come into being?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they come into being?

original: mig shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mig shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If the eyes are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they come into being?

original: rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they possibly be established?

original: gzugs shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gzugs shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since form is utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it possibly be established?

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they possibly be established?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since the eye consciousness is utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it possibly be established?

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since the ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they possibly be established?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since eye contact is utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it possibly be established?

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa @296b shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa @296b shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: contact at the nose, contact at the tongue, contact at the body, and contact at the thinking-mind are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they possibly come into being?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since feelings that arise from contact at the eye are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod //
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod //
translated: how could they possibly come into being?🔽Since feelings that arise from contact at the ear,

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: feelings that arise from contact at the nose, feelings that arise from contact at the tongue, feelings that arise from contact at the body,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: and feelings that arise from contact at the thinking-mind are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they possibly come into being?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If the perfection of generosity is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it be established?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they be established?

original: nang stong pa nyid shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If inner emptiness is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it be established?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could it be established?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If the applications of mindfulness are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they possibly be established?

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, branches of awakening, and noble eightfold path are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they possibly be established?

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: The meditative concentrations, immeasurable aspirations, formless absorptions, ten powers of the tathāgatas, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they possibly be established?

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,🔽so how could they possibly be established?

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la @297a * //
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la @297a * //
translated: How could they be established?

original: yod / nyan thos shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: yod / nyan thos shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since śrāvakas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they be established?

original: rang sangs rgyas shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since pratyekabuddhas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they be established?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they be established?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Since tathāgatas, arhats, and completely perfect buddhas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they be established?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for these reasons

original: bdag bdag ces kyang bya ste bdag shin tu med na /
analyzed: bdag bdag ces kyang bya ste bdag shin tu med na /
translated: it is said that ‘self’ is a mere convention, but since self is utterly nonexistent,

original: de mngon par 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub pa med do //
translated: it is not established.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gang chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes zer ba de ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gang chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes zer ba de ni /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, you say, ‘Are all phenomena also essentially unreal?’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is so!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di lta ste tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because there is no essentially real arising from a combination.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: ” Śāriputra then asked,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, what is it that has no essentially real arising from a combination?”

original: smras pa / gzugs la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: “Form has no essentially real arising from a combination.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness have no essentially real arising from a combination.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mig la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mig la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the eyes have no essentially real arising from a combination.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature that arises from the application of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: gzugs la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature that arises from the application of form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature that arises from the application of sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental phenomena.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature that arises from the application of the eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature that arises from the application of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature that arises from the application of eye contact.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //🔽mig @297b gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do // mig @297b gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do // rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: There is no intrinsic nature in the contact that is the coming together of the eye, and so on up to: There is no intrinsic nature in the contact that is the coming together of the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature in the feeling that arises from the contact that is the coming together of the eye, and so on up to: There is no intrinsic nature in the feeling that arises from the contact that is the coming together of the mental faculty.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature in the perfection of generosity, and so on up to: There is no intrinsic nature in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not entities that arise from application.

original: nang stong pa nyid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //🔽phyi stong pa nyid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do // phyi stong pa nyid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: inner emptiness is not an entity that arises from application,🔽outer emptiness is not an entity that arises from application,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: inner and outer emptiness is not an entity that arises from application,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is not an entity that arises from application.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: the applications of mindfulness are not entities that arise from application,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: and the noble eightfold path are not entities that arise from cultivation.🔽The meditative stabilities,🔽the immeasurable aspirations,🔽the formless absorptions,🔽the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are not entities that arise from cultivation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: all phenomena are entities that are not real.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, moreover, all phenomena are impermanent,

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of being separated from anything.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chos thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chos thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, which are those dharmas that are impermanent

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin pa de dag gang yin /
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin pa de dag gang yin /
translated: and not because of being separated from anything?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs mi rtag pa ste /🔽gang dang @298a * //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs mi rtag pa ste / gang dang @298a * //
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, form is impermanent

original: yang bral bas ma yin no //
analyzed: yang bral bas ma yin no //
translated: and not because of being separated from anything.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
translated: and not because of being separated from anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing mi zad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing mi zad pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, that which is impermanent is a nonexistent thing and is inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ste /
translated: Similarly, all dharmas are suffering, are selfless, are calm, are empty, are signless, and are wishless

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
translated: and not because of being separated from anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar smon pa med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing zad pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar smon pa med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing zad pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, in that case, the absence of wishes is a non-entity and is exhausted.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad ni dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad ni dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, all phenomena are virtuous, without offense, uncontaminated, free of afflictions, supramundane, purified,

original: 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: and unconditioned.

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
translated: They are not free from anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing zad pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing zad pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, in that case, the unconditioned is a non-entity and is exhausted.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: all phenomena are without essence.

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no //
translated: They are not free from anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no //🔽smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no // smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, all phenomena are neither permanent nor annihilated.

original: 'jig pa ma yin /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: ” He asked, “Venerable Subhūti, why are all phenomena neither permanent nor annihilated?🔽”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, form is neither permanent nor annihilated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin no //
translated: That is its nature.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither permanent nor annihilated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin no //
translated: That is their nature.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Likewise, virtuous and nonvirtuous, reprehensible and irreproachable, contaminated and uncontaminated, afflictive and

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang / 'khor ba @298b dang ; mya ngan las 'das pa yang ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang / 'khor ba @298b dang ; mya ngan las 'das pa yang ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: unafflictive, mundane and supramundane, conditioned and unconditioned, afflicted and purified phenomena, as well as saṃsāra and nirvāṇa, are not permanent and not annihilated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin pa'i phyir ro // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no /
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: // / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, through this one of many explanations, all phenomena are the nonexistence of essential nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir gzugs mngon par ma grub /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir gzugs mngon par ma grub /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, you say, ‘Why is form not real?

original: ci'i phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par ma grub ces smra zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par ma grub ces smra zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Why is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness not real?’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni de bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is just so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because form is not produced.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not produced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no producer of them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mig ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mig ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, the eyes are not produced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no producer of them.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no one who conditions them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, form is unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no one who conditions it.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: Sound, smell, taste, feeling, and mental objects are unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no one who conditions them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, eye consciousness is unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no one who conditions it.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: the ear consciousness, the nose consciousness, the tongue consciousness, the body consciousness, and the mind consciousness are unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la mngon par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no one who conditions them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad kyi bar du mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad kyi bar du mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, up to all phenomena are unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de dag la mngon @299a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de dag la mngon @299a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: par 'du byed pa po med do //
analyzed: par 'du byed pa po med do //
translated: It is because there is no one who conditions them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for that reason

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o //
translated: form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not established.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma yin /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, you asked why I said that what is not produced is not form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin zhes smra zhes zer pa ni /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin zhes smra zhes zer pa ni /
translated: and is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni de bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is so, it is so!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because form is empty of a basic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa ste /
translated: That which is empty of a basic nature does not arise and does not pass away.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not arise and does not pass away does not stand still, does not change, and does not move.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of a basic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: Whatever is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Whatever has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transformation into something else.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: In the same way, all phenomena up to and including omniscience are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis stong pa de dag la ni skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do//
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis stong pa de dag la ni skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do//
translated: Whatever is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Whatever has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transformation into something else.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma yin /
translated: whatever is unarisen is not form,

original: tshor ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ma yin /
translated: not feeling,

original: 'du shes ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes ma yin /
translated: not perception,

original: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: not volitional factors, and not consciousness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na mngon par ma grub pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ci zhig gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smra zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na mngon par ma grub pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ci zhig gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smra zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, you asked, ‘Why is it that the perfection of wisdom should instruct and teach in the unproduced?’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because the unproduced is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the unproduced.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the two dharmas called ‘unproduced’ and ‘perfection of wisdom’ are not two, nor are they divided.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason

original: 'di skad du mngon par ma grub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar @299b gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na gang mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes smra zhes zer ba ni /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di skad du mngon par ma grub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar @299b gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smras so // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na gang mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes smra zhes zer ba ni / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “In that case,” he said, “how should one instruct and teach the perfection of wisdom to someone who is not fully known?”🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, you ask, ‘Why is it that you do not apprehend any bodhisattva great being who would practice for awakening apart from what is not fully known?’

original: mngon par ma grub pa yang gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa yang gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not consider what is not fully known to be one thing and a bodhisattva to be another.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the uncreated and the bodhisattva, are not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the uncreated, he does not see form;

original: de ltar mngon par ma grub pa dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par ma grub pa dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: thus, these two dharmas, the uncreated and form, are not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the uncreated, he does not see feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness;

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: thus, these two dharmas, the uncreated and consciousness, are not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the uncreated, he does not see the eyes;

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang mig ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang mig ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unproduced and the eye, are not dual and are not not dual.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unproduced, he does not see the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, or the thinking mind.

original: de ltar mngon par ma grub pa dang yid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par ma grub pa dang yid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unproduced and the thinking mind, are not dual and are not not dual.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unproduced, he does not see form.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unproduced and form, are not dual and are not not dual.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unproduced, he does not see sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / chos zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / chos zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the two dharmas called ‘non-production’ and ‘the nose’ are not dual and are not not dual.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi rnam par @300a * //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi rnam par @300a * //
translated: Apart from non-production, the tongue is not apprehended.🔽Thus, the two dharmas called ‘non-production’ and ‘the tongue’ are not dual and are not not dual.🔽Apart from non-production, the body is not apprehended.🔽Thus, the two dharmas called ‘non-production’ and ‘the body’ are not dual and are not not dual.

original: shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-production, the mind is not apprehended.🔽Thus, the two dharmas called ‘non-production’ and ‘the mind’ are not dual and are not not dual.🔽Apart from non-production, eye consciousness is not apprehended.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the two dharmas called ‘non-production’ and ‘eye consciousness’ are not dual and are not not dual.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-production, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and thinking consciousness are not apprehended.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis byar med do //
translated: Thus, the two dharmas called ‘non-production’ and ‘thinking consciousness’ are not dual and are not not dual.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see eye contact apart from non-production.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, non-production and eye contact, are non-dual and indivisible.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-production, they do not see ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, or mind contact.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, non-production and mind contact, are non-dual and indivisible.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-production, they do not see feeling conditioned by eye contact.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas—the unproduced and what is called “feeling conditioned by eye contact”—are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
translated: Apart from the unproduced, he does not see feeling conditioned by ear contact, feeling conditioned by nose contact, feeling conditioned by tongue contact, feeling conditioned by body contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: and feeling conditioned by thinking-mind contact.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas—the unproduced and what is called “feeling conditioned by thinking-mind contact”—are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the uncreated, they do not see the applications of mindfulness.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma @300b grub pa dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma @300b grub pa dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the uncreated and the applications of mindfulness, are not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the uncreated, they do not see the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or the eightfold noble path.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the uncreated and the eightfold noble path, are not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the meditative stabilities and formless absorptions apart from non-production.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
